intro: Kernera ovalis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Kernera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
